PAN Sayangkan Menag yang Sengaja Lempar Isu Cadar-Celana Cingkrang
06 Nov 2019, 09:06 by Nur Azizah Rizki Astuti
Jakarta - PAN menyayangkan pernyataan Menteri Agama (Menag) Fachrul Razi yang sengaja melempar isu larangan cadar-celana cingkrang untuk menjadi gaung bagi masyarakat. PAN menilai Fachrul sebagai pejabat publik seharusnya tidak membuat pernyataan kontroversial yang menimbulkan kegaduhan.
"Pernyataan Menteri Agama itu tentu sangat disayangkan. Pasalnya, pejabat publik semestinya berupaya dan bekerja keras untuk menciptakan suasana teduh dan nyaman di tengah-tengah masyarakat. Bukan malah sebaliknya, sengaja melontarkan pernyataan-pernyataan kontroversial yang menimbulkan kegaduhan dan ketidakteduhan," kata Wakil Ketua F-PAN DPR Saleh Partaonan Daulay kepada wartawan, Rabu (6/11/2019).
Saleh menilai Fachrul kurang kerjaan jika memang sengaja melontarkan isu soal cadar dan celana cingkrang itu. Menurutnya, ada banyak urusan penting di Kemenag yang perlu perhatian dan penanganan serius, seperti urusan haji hingga kerukunan umat beragama.
"Semestinya, seorang menteri lebih banyak bekerja daripada bicara. Dia harus membuktikan ada inovasi baru dalam menata Kementerian Agama. Di samping itu, pemberdayaan seluruh perangkat ASN Kemenag perlu ditingkatkan untuk melayani masyarakat dengan sebaik-baiknya," ujar Saleh.
"Kementerian Agama ini termasuk kementerian besar. Karena tidak termasuk dalam ranah otonomi daerah, seluruh perangkat yang ada di kabupaten/kota dan provinsi bertanggung jawab ke Menteri. Tentu tidak mudah mengonsolidasikan dan memberdayakannya," imbuhnya.
Lebih lanjut, Saleh mengatakan isu yang disampaikan Fachrul tidak berdampak positif di masyarakat. Ia khawatir jika hanya sibuk membuat isu kontroversial, tugas-tugas Fachrul sebagai Menag justru akan tertinggl.
"Kalau sibuk dengan bikin isu kontroversial, dikhawatirkan akan tertinggal tugas pokok yang diamanahkan. Lagian, rasanya wacana dan narasi yang disampaikan tidak akan berimbas positif, bahkan sebaliknya, ada sekelompok masyarakat tertentu yang merasa dirugikan dan merasa tidak nyaman," tutur Saleh.

PAN Regretted Minister of Religion Intentionally Throwing Veil-Cingkrang Pants Issues
Nov 6, 2019, 09:06 by Nur Azizah Rizki Astuti
Jakarta - PAN regretted the statement of the Minister of Religion (Menag) Fachrul Razi who deliberately threw the issue of the ban on the veil-pants to be a reverberation for the people. PAN considers Fachrul as a public official should not make a controversial statement that causes a commotion.
"The statement of the Minister of Religion is certainly very unfortunate. The reason is that public officials should strive and work hard to create a calm and comfortable atmosphere in the midst of the community. Instead, on the contrary, deliberately make controversial statements that cause noise and disobedience," said Deputy Chairman F-PAN DPR Saleh Partaonan Daulay told reporters on Wednesday (6/11/2019).
Saleh considered Fachrul to have less work if he deliberately brought up the issue of the veil and the trousers. According to him, there are many important matters in the Ministry of Religion that need serious attention and handling, such as the affairs of the pilgrimage to religious harmony.
"Supposedly, a minister works more than talks. He must prove there are new innovations in managing the Ministry of Religion. In addition, the empowerment of all Ministry of Religion ASN tools needs to be improved to serve the community as well as possible," Saleh said.
"The Ministry of Religion is one of the major ministries. Because it is not included in the realm of regional autonomy, all instruments in the regencies / cities and provinces are responsible to the Minister. Certainly it is not easy to consolidate and empower it," he added.
Furthermore, Saleh said the issues raised by Fachrul did not have a positive impact on society. He was worried that if he was only busy making controversial issues, Fachrul's duties as Minister of Religion would actually be left behind.
"If you are busy with making controversial issues, it is feared that you will be left behind the main tasks that are entrusted. Besides, it seems that the discourse and narration delivered will not have a positive impact, on the contrary, there are certain groups of people who feel disadvantaged and feel uncomfortable," Saleh said.
